translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The eighth section
The discussion of kamma as cause

analyzed: kamma hetu arahā arahattā parihāyati iti
translated: Is an Arahant who has attained Arahantship by means of insight one who falls away owing to kamma as cause?
Yes.

analyzed: kamma hetu sotāpannaḥ sotāpatti phalā parihāyati iti
translated: Is one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry owing to kamma as cause one who falls away from the fruit of stream-entry?
That cannot be said.

analyzed: kamma hetu arahā arahattā parihāyati iti
translated: Is an Arahant who has attained Arahantship by means of insight one who falls away owing to kamma as cause?
Yes.🔽Is a once-returner …
a non-returner who has attained the fruit of non-returning owing to kamma as cause one who falls away from the fruit of non-returning?
That cannot be said.

analyzed: kamma hetu sotāpannaḥ sotāpatti phalā na parihāyati iti
translated: Is one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry owing to kamma as cause one who does not fall away from the fruit of stream-entry?
Yes.

analyzed: kamma hetu arahā arahattā na parihāyati iti
translated: Is an Arahant who has attained Arahantship by means of insight one who does not fall away from Arahantship owing to kamma as cause?🔽That cannot be said.

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  kamma hetu sakadāgāmī pe
translated: Is a once-returner …

analyzed: anāgāmī anāgāmi phalā na parihāyati iti
translated: a non-returner who has attained the fruit of non-returning one who does not fall away from the fruit of non-returning owing to kamma as cause?
Yes.

analyzed: kamma hetu arahā arahattā na parihāyati iti
translated: Is an Arahant who has attained Arahantship by means of insight one who does not fall away from Arahantship owing to kamma as cause?
That cannot be said.

analyzed: kamma hetu arahā arahattā parihāyati iti
translated: Is an Arahant who has attained Arahantship by means of insight one who falls away owing to kamma as cause?
Yes.
Is it owing to kamma as cause that he falls away?
That cannot be said.🔽Is it owing to kamma as cause that he falls away?
Yes.

analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācāra kammassa hetu  musāvāda kammassa hetu  pisuṇa vācā kammassa hetu
translated: “Is it on account of the action of sexual misconduct …🔽on account of the action of false speech …🔽on account of the action of malicious speech …

analyzed: pharusa vācā kammassa hetu  samphappalāpa kammassa hetu  mātughāta kammassa hetu
translated: on account of the action of harsh speech …🔽on account of the action of idle chatter …🔽on account of the action of mother-killing …

analyzed: pitu ghāta kammassa hetu  arahanta ghāta kammassa hetu  ruhira uppāda kammassa hetu pe
translated: on account of the action of father-killing …🔽on account of the action of killing a perfected one …🔽on account of the action of causing a schism in the Sangha …
on account of the action of maliciously drawing blood from a Buddha?”
“No, that can’t be said.”
“Then on account of which action?”
“Well then, you’re claiming to be a perfected one.”

original: Arahantānaṁ abbhācikkhanakammassa hetu arahā arahattā parihāyatīti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Ye keci arahantānaṁ abbhācikkhanti, sabbe te arahattaṁ sacchikarontīti?
analyzed: arahantānam abbhācikkhana kammassa hetu arahā arahattā parihāyati iti  āmantā  ye keci arahantānam abbhācikkhanti sabbe te arahattam sacchikaronti iti
translated: “Is it on account of the action of claiming to be a perfected one that a perfected one falls away from their perfection?”
“No, that can’t be said.”
The discussion of actions as causes is finished.
The eighth section is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Cha gatiyo, antarābhavo, pañceva kāmaguṇā kāmadhātu, pañceva āyatanā kāmā, rūpino
analyzed: cha gatiyaḥ antarābhavaḥ pañca iva kāma guṇā kāma dhātu pañca iva āyatanā kāmāḥ rūpino
translated: Six destinations, intermediate existence, and the five kinds of sense objects are the sense-sphere element. The five sense-spheres are sense-sphere sense desires.

original: dhammā rūpadhātu, arūpino dhammā arūpadhātu, saḷāyataniko attabhāvo rūpadhātuyā,
analyzed: dhammāḥ rūpa dhātu arūpinaḥ dhammāḥ arūpa dhātu saḷāyatanikaḥ atta bhāvaḥ rūpa dhātuyā
translated: Ideas which are material are the material element. Ideas which are immaterial are the immaterial element. The six-based personality is in the material element.

original: atthi rūpaṁ arūpesu, rūpaṁ kammaṁ, rūpaṁ jīvitaṁ, kammahetukā parihāyatīti.
analyzed: atthi rūpam arūpesu rūpam kamma rūpam jīvita kamma hetukā parihāyati iti
translated: There is materiality in the immaterial, materiality as kamma, materiality as life, and one falls away through kamma as cause.
